selectedProjects.name: Terminus
selectedProjects.description: A high-performance geospatial engine for trail runners. It bridges Systems Programming and the Web by leveraging Zig and WebAssembly to perform complex pathfinding and elevation profile calculations directly in-browser with near-native latency.
highlights: Custom geospatial engine in Zig for sub-millisecond data processing.
Zero-copy memory architecture between Wasm and React for fluid 3D rendering.
Optimized elevation and grade analysis algorithms for large-scale GPX datasets.

selectedProjects.name: Virtual World Demo
selectedProjects.description: An immersive spatial audio showcase built for Dolby.io. It demonstrates high-fidelity real-time communication by integrating 3D environments with spatialized WebRTC audio streams.
highlights: Dynamic 3D audio positioning based on user proximity and orientation.
Seamless integration of Dolby.io SDK with React Three Fiber for interactive UX.

selectedProjects.name: Positic
selectedProjects.description: A lightweight, robust TypeScript utility library for high-precision geolocation manipulation. Built for reliability and performance in mapping and GPS-based applications.
highlights: Functional approach to coordinate transformation and distance calculations.
Tree-shakable and developer-friendly API with 100% type safety.

selectedProjects.name: Ultra-Buddy
selectedProjects.description: A performance-oriented Progressive Web App (PWA) for ultra-endurance athletes. It transforms raw race data into actionable pacing strategies through advanced data visualization.
highlights: Custom D3.js race profile visualizations for real-time effort management.
Offline-first PWA architecture designed for remote mountain environments.

selectedProjects.name: Lybitos-Strava
selectedProjects.description: A mobile-first athlete dashboard that bridges the Strava ecosystem with a custom React Native experience, focusing on clean data presentation and seamless API integration.
highlights: Robust OAuth2 flow and secure data synchronization with Strava REST APIs.
Reactive state management for real-time activity updates on mobile.

about: I first fell into the coding rabbit hole in 1998, and that curiosity has never left me. From early desktop apps to building complex software for global leaders like Lectra, my journey has always been about one thing: making technology work better for people.

These days, I’m focused on the frontier of web performance. I love exploring modern tools like Zig and WebAssembly to bring near-native speed to the browser. My specialty is turning heavy, complex data into smooth, meaningful experiences—whether I’m architecting industrial solutions or crafting high-performance tools for the trail running community.
When I’m away from my desk, you’ll find me road or trail running, enjoying life with my wife and daughter, or getting lost in my favorite music.
